Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Beverage \Bev"er*age\, n. [OF. bevrage, F. breuvage, fr. beivre to drink, fr. L. bibere. Cf. {Bib}, v. t., {Poison}, {Potable}.] 1. Liquid for drinking; drink; -- usually applied to drink artificially prepared and of an agreeable flavor; as, an intoxicating beverage. [1913 Webster]
He knew no beverage but the flowing stream. --Thomson. [1913 Webster]
2. Specifically, a name applied to various kinds of drink. [1913 Webster]
3. A treat, or drink money. [Slang] [1913 Webster]
beverage n : any liquid suitable for drinking; "may I take your beverage order?" [syn: {drink}, {drinkable}, {potable}]
